From what I gathered by looking at the UI, the baseUrls array are URLs that are authorized on that card. As in, HubSpot is allowing those URLs to be hit with requests. When you respond to HubSpot with the data, you can define the actions within your objects in that second payload you posted.

Confusion with expected request for CRM Card Custom Action -
When sending (based on example here: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview#sales-object-properties>) to the Create Card API
```"actions": {
        "type": "ACTION_HOOK",
        "confirmationMessage": "Are you sure you want to delete this ticket?",
        "confirmButtonText": "Yes",
        "cancelButtonText": "No",
        "httpMethod": "DELETE",
        "associatedObjectProperties": [
            "protected_account"
        ],
        "uri": "<https://api.hubapi.com/linked-sales-objects-test-application/v1/actions/demo-ticket/988>",
        "label": "Delete"
    },```
I get back:
```"actions": {
        "baseUrls": []
    }```
How do I create a card with an ACTION_HOOK?
Ah, so first I have to create the baseurl, and then from the base url, I would post the action object of which I want. Am I understanding that correctly?
Question replied to in thread a couple of messages up.

Almost. As shown in the little helper popup, you define all of the endpoints you are going to use as "actions" within your data response here on the tab.

HubSpot hits the endpoint defined in the "Data request" tab, and you respond with objects and actions. Those action endpoints must be authorized in the "Custom actions" tab.

Okay, so it goes something like
1. List Base action URL
2. HubSpot will query the listed URL for actions
3. Listed URL returns objects and actions based on what HubSpot sent with it's query back to HubSpot's card
4. Card display the customer objects and actions
Did I get that right? Sorry, I just started integration with HubSpot

Don't worry it took me a few hours to wrap my head around this CRM Card extension lol.
It goes like:
1. Enter the `Data fetch URL`
2. Enter all action endpoints your CRM card will hit under the `Base action URLs`
3. Enter any `Card properties` you want to display on your CRM card
4. HubSpot will hit the `Data fetch URL` with a GET request and your integration will respond with <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview#data-fetch-request|something like this example response>.
    a. There are actions in that response. Action hook URIs must be included within the `Base action URLs` array in order for them to work (Not sure if HubSpot will allow the request if it isn't defined).

Ahh okay, I think I understand.
It's the get request from HubSpot that allows custom actions, and not the original post request I made to HubSpot to create the card using postman.
